conclusion: Analyze forces on spheres focusing on equilibrium for sphere D and spheres A, B, C.
Four spheres form a tetrahedral structure with bottom spheres forming an equilateral triangle.
Radius of each sphere is r and mass is m.
Distance between centers of bottom spheres is 2r.
Height from center of sphere D to plane of A, B, C is h = sqrt(8/3)r.
Forces on sphere D include gravitational force mg and normal forces NA, NB, NC.
Normal forces NA, NB, NC are equal due to symmetry.
Vertical component of normal forces must balance gravitational force: 3N cos(theta) = mg.
Cos(theta) calculated as sqrt(2/5) using geometry.
Pressure on each bottom sphere is N = mg sqrt(10)/6.
Final answer: Pressure of D on A, B, C is mg sqrt(10)/6.
